analyzed: lus sems 'brel pa gcad pa'i bsam gtan la /
translated: The disciple who is a suitable vessel, who is diligent in practice, and who has faith, should gradually practice the concentration that severs the connection between the body and mind.

original: blo bkal nas bsgrubs na rang dang @92b gzhan gnyis ka'i don 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: blo bkal nas bsgrubs na rang dang @92b gzhan gnyis ka'i don 'byung ba ni /

original: nang du chos nyid sgra'i mtha' las grol bas /
analyzed: nang du chos nyid sgra'i mtha' las grol bas /
translated: Internally, since dharmatā is free from the extremes of sound,

original: rang don rim gyis rdzogs la /
analyzed: rang don rim gyis rdzogs la /
translated: one’s own benefit is gradually perfected.

original: phyi chos nyid sgra la mthar gyis gnas pam yin te /
analyzed: phyi chos nyid sgra la mthar gyis gnas pam yin te /
translated: Externally, since dharmatā is not gradually placed in sound,

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas gzhan don rim gyis rdzogs bas na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas gzhan don rim gyis rdzogs bas na /
translated: since it is present in the nature of the ultimate, the benefit for others is gradually perfected.

original: de la sangs rgyas tha snyad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas tha snyad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that is called the “convention of buddhahood.”

original: de lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngon du byas nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa sngon du byas nas /
translated: Having performed the preliminaries endowed with the characteristics of engaging in such concentration,

original: da ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi lus sems 'brel pa gcad pa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: da ni bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi lus sems 'brel pa gcad pa ni dgu ste /
translated: now, there are nine topics in the main subject of concentration that severs the connection between the body and mind.

original: lus 'pho ba'i rta la brten nas lus kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba'i rim pa dang / de nas rang sems dos bzung nas skyon dang yon tan gyi rnam pa btsal ba dang / de nas sems kyi gnas pa btsal ba dang / gnas pa rang thog tu gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: lus 'pho ba'i rta la brten nas lus kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba'i rim pa dang / de nas rang sems dos bzung nas skyon dang yon tan gyi rnam pa btsal ba dang / de nas sems kyi gnas pa btsal ba dang / gnas pa rang thog tu gzhag pa dang /
translated: resting in one’s own place of abiding,🔽and having abided in that way, the decisive experience of nonabiding pristine consciousness,🔽the time of the union of the decisive experience and one’s mind,🔽the stages of how to practice the yoga of the mind,

original: de ltar gnas nas mi gnas pa'i ye shes su la bzla ba dang / la bzla ba rang sems dang 'byor pa'i dus brtsi ba dang / sems kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba'i rim pa dang / de nyid mthar thug bsam gtan gyi man ngag tu ma song na ji ltar bcos pa'i rim pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar gnas nas mi gnas pa'i ye shes su la bzla ba dang / la bzla ba rang sems dang 'byor pa'i dus brtsi ba dang / sems kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba'i rim pa dang / de nyid mthar thug bsam gtan gyi man ngag tu ma song na ji ltar bcos pa'i rim pa dang /
translated: and the stages of how to correct if that does not become the intimate instruction of concentration,🔽the meaning of the view that does not cling to the end of sound is based on the tantra of the yogin,

original: sgra'i mtha' mi zhen par lta ba'i don rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la brten pa dang / sems kyi bya ba'i rnam pa las yid 'byung ba'i bla mas /
analyzed: sgra'i mtha' mi zhen par lta ba'i don rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la brten pa dang / sems kyi bya ba'i rnam pa las yid 'byung ba'i bla mas /
translated: and the guru who is disgusted with the aspects of mental activity

original: sgra mthar gyis bsam gtan du nges par sgrol ba'i tshad bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra mthar gyis bsam gtan du nges par sgrol ba'i tshad bstan pa'o //
translated: teaches the measure of the definitive liberation into the end of sound and concentration.

original: dang po lus 'pho ba'i rta la brten nas lus kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba'i rim pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dang po lus 'pho ba'i rta la brten nas lus kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba'i rim pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The first is the explanation of the stage of how to perform the yoga of the body in dependence on the horse of the transference of the body.

original: lus 'byung ba rang rkyen las 'phos pas thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub longs ci dgar spyod pa dang / lha'i sku mdog dang bzhugs tshul la 'phos pas tha mal pa'i bag chags kyi rgyun gcad pa dang / chos nyid sgyu mas ye shes sgyu mar 'phos pas lus sems kyi 'brel pa rgyun bzlog pa'i gnad do //
analyzed: lus 'byung ba rang rkyen las 'phos pas thun mong dang mchog gi dngos grub longs ci dgar spyod pa dang / lha'i sku mdog dang bzhugs tshul la 'phos pas tha mal pa'i bag chags kyi rgyun gcad pa dang / chos nyid sgyu mas ye shes sgyu mar 'phos pas lus sems kyi 'brel pa rgyun bzlog pa'i gnad do //
translated: Since the elements of the body are transferred by their own conditions, one can enjoy the common and supreme siddhis as one wishes; since the color and posture of the deity’s body are transferred, the continuum of the traces of ordinariness is severed; and since the illusion of dharmatā is transferred into the illusion of gnosis, the continuum of the connection between the body and mind is reversed.

original: 'byung ba rkyen la 'pho ba ni rtag tu 'byung ba bzhi'am lnga'i rnal 'byor du bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba rkyen la 'pho ba ni rtag tu 'byung ba bzhi'am lnga'i rnal 'byor du bya ste /
translated: The transference of the elements into the conditions is always performed as the yoga of the four or five elements.

original: sa'i rnal 'byor ni lus sna tshogs pa'i khrus dang / bum ba'i cho ga bya /
analyzed: sa'i rnal 'byor ni lus sna tshogs pa'i khrus dang / bum ba'i cho ga bya /
translated: The yoga of earth is the ablution of the various bodies and the vase empowerment.

original: de ltar chu dang me dang rlung dang khrus bya zhing lus la bum pa'i cho ga bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar chu dang me dang rlung dang khrus bya zhing lus la bum pa'i cho ga bya zhing /
translated: In that way, the ablutions of water, fire, and air are performed, and the vase empowerment is performed on the body.

original: nam mkha'i khrus ni lus gcer bur phyung la bdud rtsi lngas khrus rtag tu bya /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khrus ni lus gcer bur phyung la bdud rtsi lngas khrus rtag tu bya /
translated: The “space ablution” is to always perform ablutions naked with the five elixirs.

original: de yang sa'i rnal 'byor byed pa'i dus na /
analyzed: de yang sa'i rnal 'byor byed pa'i dus na /
translated: Moreover, when performing the yoga of earth,

original: sa sna tshogs pa la rig sngags bzlas pa brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
analyzed: sa sna tshogs pa la rig sngags bzlas pa brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
translated: one should recite the awareness mantra one hundred and eight times over various types of earth,

original: nyin re la lus la lan gsum gsum du byug cing /
analyzed: nyin re la lus la lan gsum gsum du byug cing /
translated: and apply it to one’s body three times each day.

original: lus mgo mjug tu bsku mnye bya'o //
analyzed: lus mgo mjug tu bsku mnye bya'o //
translated: One should massage one’s body from head to toe.

original: chu ni khrus chog dang mthun /🔽me ni shing sna tshogs pa'i @93a * //
analyzed: chu ni khrus chog dang mthun / me ni shing sna tshogs pa'i @93a * //
translated: The water ablution is in accordance with the ablution ritual.

original: yam shing dang / bum pa'i nang du bcug ste sngags gong ltar bzlas la bum pa'i nad du mar dang ldan pa'i me btang ste /
analyzed: yam shing dang / bum pa'i nang du bcug ste sngags gong ltar bzlas la bum pa'i nad du mar dang ldan pa'i me btang ste /
translated: The fire ablution is to recite the above mantra over a kindling wood of various types of wood,🔽and to light a fire of butter in the vase, and burn one’s hair, beard, and so on, three times each day and three times each night.

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du skra dang kha spu la sogs pa rnams bsreg / rlung gi rnal 'byor bum pa'i nang du phyogs bzhi ka'i rlung gis bkang ste /
analyzed: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum du skra dang kha spu la sogs pa rnams bsreg / rlung gi rnal 'byor bum pa'i nang du phyogs bzhi ka'i rlung gis bkang ste /
translated: The wind yoga is to fill the vase with the winds of the four directions,

original: sngags bzlas la gang nas rlung byung ba'i phyogs su kha bltas la khrus kyi las bya'o //
analyzed: sngags bzlas la gang nas rlung byung ba'i phyogs su kha bltas la khrus kyi las bya'o //
translated: recite the mantra, and perform the ablution ritual facing the direction from which the wind is coming.

original: nam mkha'i ni bdud rtsi'i khrus byas la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i ni bdud rtsi'i khrus byas la /
translated: Having bathed in the nectar of space,

original: nam mkha' la bum pa'i khri'i steng du bzhag la phyogs kun nas rig sngags kyi lha'i sngags kyis thun gyis brab po //
analyzed: nam mkha' la bum pa'i khri'i steng du bzhag la phyogs kun nas rig sngags kyi lha'i sngags kyis thun gyis brab po //
translated: one should place the vase in space on a throne, and strike it with the mantra of the knowledge-goddesses from all directions.

original: de ltar byas pas lus kyi sdig pa til 'bru tsa ma yang med par dag ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas pas lus kyi sdig pa til 'bru tsa ma yang med par dag ste /
translated: By doing it in this way, the body's sins, even as small as sesame seeds, are purified, and

original: de ltar lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
analyzed: de ltar lan grangs brgya rtsa brgyad byas na /
translated: having done it one hundred and eight times,

original: lus la gnas mi srid do //
analyzed: lus la gnas mi srid do //
translated: it is impossible for them to remain in the body.

original: de ltar rgyun du byas na thun mong du lus 'byung ba la dbang sgyur nus pa dang / mchog tu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku thob pas rtags dang cho 'phrul sna tshogs la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rgyun du byas na thun mong du lus 'byung ba la dbang sgyur nus pa dang / mchog tu rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku thob pas rtags dang cho 'phrul sna tshogs la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: If one does it in this way continuously, in common [one obtains] the ability to control the elements of the body, and in the supreme [one obtains] the body of a vajra-holder, and so one enjoys various miracles and wonders.

original: lha'i sku mdog dang bzhugs tshul la 'pho ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: lha'i sku mdog dang bzhugs tshul la 'pho ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa dang 'dra ste /
translated: The transference of the color and posture of the deity's body is similar to the creation stage.

original: tha mal pa'i lus kyi zhen pa la sogs pas ye shes lha'i skur bzhengs pas lus kyi zhen pa'i sdig pa gnas mi srid do //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus kyi zhen pa la sogs pas ye shes lha'i skur bzhengs pas lus kyi zhen pa'i sdig pa gnas mi srid do //
translated: Since one arises in the body of the wisdom deity by the attachment to the ordinary body and so forth, it is impossible for the sin of attachment to the body to remain.

original: chos nyid sgyums ye shes sgyu ma'i nang du 'pho ba ni /
analyzed: chos nyid sgyums ye shes sgyu ma'i nang du 'pho ba ni /
translated: The transference into the inner illusion of the illusion of dharmatā is as follows:

original: lus yod ma myong bas stong par gsal bas chos nyid las 'gro sa med do //
analyzed: lus yod ma myong bas stong par gsal bas chos nyid las 'gro sa med do //
translated: Since the body has never existed, it is empty and clear, so there is no place to go other than dharmatā.

original: de nyid las rang bzhin med pas rgyun kun brtags su grub ma myong bas phung po gnas gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid las rang bzhin med pas rgyun kun brtags su grub ma myong bas phung po gnas gyur te /
translated: Since it is nonexistent, the continuum is not established in the imagined, and the skandhas are transformed.

original: de nyid mtshan ma rdzas grub yod mi srid pas ye shes sgyu lus su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid mtshan ma rdzas grub yod mi srid pas ye shes sgyu lus su gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it is impossible for that to exist as a substantial sign, it abides as the illusory body of pristine consciousness.

original: de ltar gnas pa lus stong pa rang bzhin med par snang la /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa lus stong pa rang bzhin med par snang la /
translated: As such, the body abides as empty and appearing without a nature.

original: sdig pa rgyu med pas stong pas gos pa med do //
analyzed: sdig pa rgyu med pas stong pas gos pa med do //
translated: Since the cause of evil is empty, there is no contamination.🔽At the time of the transformation, the earth appears as a yellow vajra of immeasurable size and extent.

original: de yang 'gyur ba'i dus na sa'i rdo rje ser po rgya khyon dpag tu med par snang ba dang de bzhin du chu'i rdo rje dkar po me'i dmar po /
analyzed: de yang 'gyur ba'i dus na sa'i rdo rje ser po rgya khyon dpag tu med par snang ba dang de bzhin du chu'i rdo rje dkar po me'i dmar po /
translated: Likewise, the water is a white vajra, the fire is a red vajra,

original: rlung gi ljang gu'o //
analyzed: rlung gi ljang gu'o //
translated: and the wind is a green vajra.

original: nam mkha'i mdog mthing ga rgya dang khyon dpag tu med pa ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mdog mthing ga rgya dang khyon dpag tu med pa ldang bar bya'o //
translated: The color of space is blue, and the size and extent are immeasurable.

original: lha'i skur ldang ba nyid du ldang ba dang / gsum ni sku gsum du grol ba'i gnad do //🔽rang sems ngos gzung la yon tan btsal ba ni /🔽de ltar byas pa'i lus gsum gyi dus na sems ji ltar gnas na /
analyzed: lha'i skur ldang ba nyid du ldang ba dang / gsum ni sku gsum du grol ba'i gnad do // rang sems ngos gzung la yon tan btsal ba ni / de ltar byas pa'i lus gsum gyi dus na sems ji ltar gnas na /
translated: The arising of the body of the deity is the arising of the three kāyas.

translated: The three are the critical point of liberation into the three kāyas.

translated: eliminated by the focus, the faults of the immediate conditions of🔽stains are destroyed.

original: la bzla ba rang sems dang 'byor pa'i dus rtsi ba sems kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba ni /
analyzed: la bzla ba rang sems dang 'byor pa'i dus rtsi ba sems kyi rnal 'byor ji ltar bya ba ni /
translated: The time of being familiar with one’s mind is the time of the yoga of the mind.

original: mi gnas pa gnas par rang gi sems la 'byor pa'i dus ni /
analyzed: mi gnas pa gnas par rang gi sems la 'byor pa'i dus ni /
translated: The time of being familiar with one’s mind in the nonabiding abiding is as follows:

original: dang po yul ni bdag nyid mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dang po yul ni bdag nyid mi gnas pa'o //
translated: First, the object is oneself not abiding.

original: de'i dus su sems ni yang nas yang du dgug pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su sems ni yang nas yang du dgug pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: At that time, one should be skilled in repeatedly withdrawing the mind.

original: gnyis pa yul shes kyi rtsa ba 'dor ba'i dus ni dran pa rgyun 'gags nas rlung phyi nang du 'gyur pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa yul shes kyi rtsa ba 'dor ba'i dus ni dran pa rgyun 'gags nas rlung phyi nang du 'gyur pa med pa'o //
translated: Second, the time of discarding the root of the object and consciousness is when the stream of mindfulness is interrupted and the vāyu does not move in and out.

original: de'i dus su sems yang nas yang du 'phang ba la mkhas par bya'o //🔽gsum pa ngo bo ngos gzung gi @94a * //
analyzed: de'i dus su sems yang nas yang du 'phang ba la mkhas par bya'o // gsum pa ngo bo ngos gzung gi @94a * //

analyzed: 'dzin pa rang 'gags pa'i dus ni chos dang gang zag la mi gnas par bsam gtan la ched du byed pa rgyun chad ba'o //
translated: Third, the time of the cessation of grasping the identification of the essence is when one does not abide in phenomena or persons, and the purpose of concentration is interrupted.

original: de'i dus su sems yang nas yang du sbyar ba la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus su sems yang nas yang du sbyar ba la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should be skilled in repeatedly applying the mind.

original: mthar thug pa bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor du song na bcos pa ni /
analyzed: mthar thug pa bsam gtan gyi rnal 'byor du song na bcos pa ni /
translated: The ultimate is when the yoga of concentration has been achieved.

original: lus la tsandan lde gus byugs la /
analyzed: lus la tsandan lde gus byugs la /
translated: Anoint the body with sandalwood paste.

original: yan lag h'um dang ldan par bya /
analyzed: yan lag h'um dang ldan par bya /
translated: Endow the limbs with the syllable hūṃ.

original: sems rlung gi 'gro 'od la sbyar bar byas te /
analyzed: sems rlung gi 'gro 'od la sbyar bar byas te /
translated: Apply the mind to the going and coming of the wind.

original: gsal bar nyams su myong pa'i shes pa bde gsal rang thog tu chod /
analyzed: gsal bar nyams su myong pa'i shes pa bde gsal rang thog tu chod /
translated: The experience of clarity is the bliss-clarity that is resolved right on its own place.

original: de stong pa rjes med du grol //
analyzed: de stong pa rjes med du grol //
translated: That is liberated without a trace of emptiness.

original: de nyid mtha' gang du dmigs pa dang bral ba'i nyams su myong ba rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la skye bar nges so //
analyzed: de nyid mtha' gang du dmigs pa dang bral ba'i nyams su myong ba rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la skye bar nges so //
translated: That is the experience free from observing any extreme that will definitely arise in the mind of the yogin.

original: sgra'i mtha' la mi zhen pa'i ltab don rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la skye ba ni /
analyzed: sgra'i mtha' la mi zhen pa'i ltab don rnal 'byor pa'i rgyud la skye ba ni /
translated: The meaning of the explanation that is not attached to the end of words arises in the mind of the yogin.

original: phyi nang gi dmigs pa ni ched du byed pa la blo log pas /
analyzed: phyi nang gi dmigs pa ni ched du byed pa la blo log pas /
translated: Since the outer and inner referents are rejected as objects of attention,🔽the relative is the meaning of the view of the common subject that is based on the tantra.

original: kun rdzob tu chos can thun mong du lta ba'i don rgyud la brten pa dmigs pa tsam las rang rgyud la zhen pa med pas don dam par chos nyid khyad par lta ba'i don rgyud la brten pa'o //

translated: Since there is no attachment to the tantra, the ultimate is the meaning of the view of the special dharmatā that is based on the tantra.

original: de ltar dmigs pa sgra'i rnam pa la zhen pa 'jug pa rang 'gags pas don dam dang kun rdzob gnyis su med pa'i sgra tsam du yang 'jug pa de bral ba'i lta ba'i don rgyud la brten pa'o //

original: 'khor ba 'dod pa'i blo gnas mi srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba 'dod pa'i blo gnas mi srid pa'o //
translated: Since it does not abide, it is impossible for the mind that desires🔽samsāra to abide.🔽Since it does not abide in that way, no matter what the profound

analyzed: de ltar mi gnas pas bsam gtan zab mo 'gro nyal 'dug pa'i rnam pa gang du yang 'dug kyang /
translated: concentration does—walking, sleeping, or sitting—

original: de nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi sems med pa ni tshad de /
analyzed: de nyid las ma gtogs pa gzhan gyi sems med pa ni tshad de /
translated: since there is no other mind except that, it is the measure.

original: de ltar gnas pas bsam pa yid dge ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pas bsam pa yid dge ba zhes bya ba /
translated: Since it abides in that way, it is called “the virtuous mind of🔽thought.”

original: de nyid las mi 'gyur bar brtan pas sems ldang ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid las mi 'gyur bar brtan pas sems ldang ba ste /
translated: Since it is stable and does not move from that, the mind arises.

original: de nyid las ma gto gas par gzhan sems med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul nyid pas sems can gyi ming med do //
analyzed: de nyid las ma gto gas par gzhan sems med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul nyid pas sems can gyi ming med do //
translated: Apart from that, there is no other mind, and since that is the domain of the Buddha alone, there is no name of sentient being.

original: sgra mthar gyis rnal 'byor pa'i lus sems kyi 'brel ba gcad pa /
analyzed: sgra mthar gyis rnal 'byor pa'i lus sems kyi 'brel ba gcad pa /
translated: The yoga of the end of sound is the severing of the connection of the body and mind.

original: slob dpon chen po dpal mar me mdzad bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa phyogs gcig tu bsdebs pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: slob dpon chen po dpal mar me mdzad bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs pa'i rim pa phyogs gcig tu bsdebs pa rdzogs so//
translated: The one-sided compilation of the completion stage composed by the great master Śrī Dīpaṃkara bhadra is finished.
